intro: Thelycrania coreana, commonly known as the Korean starflower, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
